title: Patriot Day 2025, the 24th Anniversary of the September 11 Terrorist Attacks
summary: The document is a presidential proclamation declaring September 11, 2025, as Patriot Day, marking the 24th anniversary of the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks. It recounts the events of that day, including the hijackings and crashes of four commercial jets, the loss of 2,977 lives, and the heroic actions of passengers on Flight 93. The proclamation honors the victims, first responders, and the enduring spirit of the American people. It reaffirms the nation's commitment to never forget the attacks and to stand united against any future threats. The president calls for the display of the U.S. flag at half-staff and encourages reflection and remembrance of the events and their impact.
